summary.p: The money for the spices has arrived. Gast will occasionally inquire with Heinrich Petri about the price of the Boethius [edition].
- The people of Strasbourg have sent four companies of Landsknechte to Landgrave [Philipp] of Hesse.

- A captain [...] from the camp of King [Francis I] of France wrote to his mother [...] in Basel, saying that he would have already returned home if the Landgrave had not recruited his [troop unit], which was released by the peace agreement between [Francis I] of France and [Henry VIII] of England.
- In Basel, there is talk of a planned attack by [Philipp of] Hesse and Duke [Francis] of [Brunswick]-L端neburg against Brabant. The Lord will destroy that Pharaoh [Charles V]!
- Many mercenaries are leaving again because they were not told the reason for the war and the enemy.
- In Basel, a banner and a company were raised.
- The furious Emperor [Charles V] is weakened. The priests will certainly perish!
- More details will be reported by Myconius [with No. 2482].
- [Duke Maurice of] Saxony secures the border towns to Bohemia against surprise attacks.
- The [Strasbourg] envoys [Heinrich von M端llenheim and Michael Han] at the Imperial Diet in Regensburg will be back in Strasbourg within three days due to the impending danger.
- PS.: The people of Strasbourg have so far recruited about seven companies. The Alsatians have been forbidden by Margrave [George of W端rttemberg] to enter foreign service.

div.p: Greetings in the Lord. I have received the money for the spices. I will inform you of the price of the Boethius edition if I see Mr. Heinrich Petri.
The people of Strasbourg have sent four companies of Landsknechte to the Landgrave of Hesse.

I also read a letter written by a captain from the camp of the King of France to his mother, who lives in Basel, saying he would have already returned home. The Landgrave of Hesse has recruited the troop unit after peace was made between the French and the English.

There is talk among us that the Landgrave of Hesse and the Duke of L端neburg are planning to attack Brabant, where there are many armored horses and foot soldiers. May God grant success and salvation! I know the Lord will not abandon us, but with His help, He will destroy that Pharaoh and cast him into hell.
Many mercenaries are returning. The reason is that they are not being told where they are supposed to go or against whom.
Our people have raised a banner and a company. The Emperor is furious, blowing his last breath. The priests must go to the devil.

I wanted to write these few things to you; the rest Myconius will report. The Saxon is preparing and fortifying the places facing Bohemia to prevent an unexpected invasion. I know well that the envoys from Strasbourg have returned home in three days from Regensburg, where no one has said anything about the imminent danger. God can break and annihilate all the plans of the wicked; at least let us trust in the Lord, call upon Him with heart and mouth.

The people of Strasbourg are still recruiting mercenaries. They have about seven companies. In Alsace, no one wants to enlist, as the Margrave has forbidden anyone to join any lord, whoever he may be, under penalty of life and property.
To the honorable Lord Heinrich Bullinger, pastor in Zurich, my gracious and dear lord, to his hands.
